intro: Pedicularis columigera, commonly known as the mountain lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it forms a low-growing rosette of fleshy, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips and a distinctive hooded structure. Pedicularis columigera is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas with limited soil nutrients.
